Section 2. The sums appropriated by subsections (a), (b),, (c), and (g) of section one of this Act shall be distributed in the discretion of the Secretary of the Interior; those appropriated by subsections (h), (i), (j), (m), and (q) shall be distributed in the discretion of the Secretary of Public Instruction; those appropriated by subsections (£), («), and (.t) shall be distributed in the discretion of the Secretary of Agriculture and Natural Resources; that appropriated by subsection (s) shall be distributed by the Secretary of Finance; and those appropriated in subsections (d), (e), (/), (z), (bb), (cc), (del), (ee), (ff), (gg), (ii), (kk), {mm), and (nn) shall be distributed in the discretion of the Secretary of Commerce and Communications.
Section 3. All balances of the several appropriations made by this Act and by other previous public works Acts that remain unexpended or the destination of which has not yet been determined by the Department concerned on June thirtieth, nineteen hundred and nineteen, shall be reverted to the unappropriated funds in the Insular Treasury, and thereafter shall not be available for expenditure except upon appropriation by the Legislature.
Section 4. Whenever the Secretary of Finance shall believe that the probable revenues of the Insular Government will not be sufficient to cover the projects provided for in this Act, he shall so report to the Governor-General who, upon the recommendation of the Department Secretaries acting jointly, is hereby authorized to suspend in whole or in part, temporarily or definitely, the construction of any specified project or projects provided for in this Act, until otherwise ordered by the Legislature.
Section 5. This Act shall take effect on its approval.
Approved, February 15, 1918.
